alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Furnas; Harlan; Howard; Nance; Nuckolls; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 8:44PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...At Least Minor Accumulation Of Wet, Slushy Snow Likely Overnight In Counties Just South and Also North of the Main Snow Band... Although the heaviest, west-to-east oriented band of wet, slushy snow should focus within counties mainly along the Highway 6 and Interstate 80 corridors overnight, at least limited snow accumulation mainly ranging from a dusting to 1 inch will be possible in portions of counties south of the main band along the Kansas border, and also in a few counties north of the main band such as Howard and Nance. Given that the main snow band is currently expected to remain both north and south of these counties, a formal Winter Weather Advisory is not in effect at this time. However, trends will be closely monitored tonight, just in case the main snow band shifts farther north or south from current expectations.

area.areaDesc: Franklin; Furnas; Harlan; Howard; Nance; Nuckolls; Webster
